actions.text: Amendment SA 144 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 55. Record Vote Number: 47.

Amendment SA 144 proposed by Senator Conrad. (consideration: CR S2668-2676, S2680-2685, S2692; text: CR S2668) To ensure that 75-year solvency has been restored to Social Security before Congress considers new deficit-financed legislation that would increase mandatory spending or cut taxes.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 144 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 55. Record Vote Number: 47.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 144 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 55. Record Vote Number: 47.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 144 proposed by Senator Conrad.

purpose: To ensure that 75-year solvency has been restored to Social Security before Congress considers new deficit-financed legislation that would increase mandatory spending or cut taxes.
